name: Vera Farmiga
description:
'''Vera Ann Farmiga''' ({{IPAc-en|f|ɑr|ˈ|m|iː|ɡ|ə}} {{Respell|far|MEE|gə}}; born August 6, 1973) is an American actress and singer. She began her professional acting career on stage in the original [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] production of ''[[Taking Sides (play)|Taking Sides]]'' (1996). After expanding to television and film, her [[Breakthrough role|breakthrough]] came with her starring role as a drug addict in the drama ''[[Down to the Bone (film)|Down to the Bone]]'' (2004). She then had roles in the political thriller ''[[The Manchurian Candidate (2004 film)|The Manchurian Candidate]]'' (2004), the crime drama ''[[The Departed]]'' (2006), and the historical drama ''[[The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas (film)|The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas]]'' (2008). She was also established as a [[scream queen]] for her performances in the horror films ''[[Joshua (2007 film)|Joshua]]'' (2007) and ''[[Orphan (2009 film)|Orphan]]'' (2009).

For her performance in the comedy-drama ''[[Up in the Air (2009 film)|Up in the Air]]'' (2009), Farmiga was nominated for an [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]] and [[List of awards and nominations received by Vera Farmiga|other accolades]]. She then made her directorial debut with the drama film ''[[Higher Ground (film)|Higher Ground]]'' (2011), in which she had the leading role. She starred in the thrillers ''[[Source Code (film)|Source Code]]'' (2011) and ''[[Safe House (2012 film)|Safe House]]'' (2012), before furthering her scream queen status by portraying paranormal investigator [[Ed and Lorraine Warren|Lorraine Warren]] in [[the Conjuring Universe]] films ''[[The Conjuring]]'' (2013), ''[[The Conjuring 2]]'' (2016), ''[[Annabelle Comes Home]]'' (2019), ''[[The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It]]'' (2021), and ''[[The Conjuring: Last Rites]]'' (2025). She also starred in the legal drama ''[[The Judge (2014 film)|The Judge]]'' (2014), the biographical drama ''[[The Front Runner (film)|The Front Runner]]'' (2018), the monster film ''[[Godzilla: King of the Monsters (2019 film)|Godzilla: King of the Monsters]]'' (2019), and the crime drama ''[[The Many Saints of Newark]]'' (2021).

On television, Farmiga received [[Primetime Emmy Awards|Primetime Emmy Award]] nominations for playing [[Norma Bates (Psycho)|Norma Louise Bates]] in the [[A&E (TV channel)|A&E]] drama horror series ''[[Bates Motel (TV series)|Bates Motel]]'' (2013–2017) and starring in the [[Netflix]] miniseries ''[[When They See Us]]'' (2019). She also appears in the [[Disney+]] miniseries ''[[Hawkeye (miniseries)|Hawkeye]]'' (2021) set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]], and the [[Apple TV+]] miniseries ''[[Five Days at Memorial (miniseries)|Five Days at Memorial]]'' (2022).
